title: The Beths Announce New Album Straight Line Was a Lie, Share “No Joy”: Stream
description: The follow-up to 2022's Expert in a Dying Field arrives on August 29th. The Beths Announce New Album Straight Line Was a Lie, Share “No Joy”: Stream Scott Sterling
author: Scott Sterling
excerpt: The Beths have announced their new album, Straight Line Was a Lie, out August 29th. They've also shared the latest single, "No Joy."
text: The Beths have announced their fourth studio album, Straight Line Was a Lie, out August 29th. As a preview, the indie rockers have also revealed their new song, “No Joy,” and its accompanying video. Stream it below. Straight Line Was a Lie is the band’s first studio album since 2022’s Expert in a Dying Field, and their first on new label, ANTI-. The band cites “existential vertigo” as the album’s primary theme, along with the idea that going through transformative experiences doesn’t always result in the desired effect. Get The Beths Tickets Here “Linear progression is an illusion,” vocalist Elizabeth Stokes said in a press statement. “What life really is is maintenance. But you can find meaning in the maintenance.” On that note, “No Joy” delves into Stokes’ mental health journey. “It’s about anhedonia, which, paradoxically, was there both in the worst parts of depression, and then also when I was feeling pretty numb on my SSRI,” she said. “It wasn’t that I was sad, I was feeling pretty good. It was just that I didn’t like the things that I liked. I wasn’t getting joy from them. It’s very literal.” Watch the Frances Carter-directed video for “No Joy” below. The quartet recently added a handful of new dates to their extensive 2025 tour, with additional shows in cities including Dublin, San Francisco, Toronto, and Boston. See the full itinerary below, and get tickets here. “Metal,” the first single from Straight Line Is a Lie, was released in April. Pre-orders for the album are ongoing. html:
The Beths have announced their fourth studio album, Straight Line Was a Lie, out August 29th. As a preview, the indie rockers have also revealed their new song, “No Joy,” and its accompanying video. Stream it below.

Straight Line Was a Lie is the band’s first studio album since 2022’s Expert in a Dying Field, and their first on new label, ANTI-. The band cites “existential vertigo” as the album’s primary theme, along with the idea that going through transformative experiences doesn’t always result in the desired effect.

Get The Beths Tickets Here

“Linear progression is an illusion,” vocalist Elizabeth Stokes said in a press statement. “What life really is is maintenance. But you can find meaning in the maintenance.”

On that note, “No Joy” delves into Stokes’ mental health journey. “It’s about anhedonia, which, paradoxically, was there both in the worst parts of depression, and then also when I was feeling pretty numb on my SSRI,” she said. “It wasn’t that I was sad, I was feeling pretty good. It was just that I didn’t like the things that I liked. I wasn’t getting joy from them. It’s very literal.”

Watch the Frances Carter-directed video for “No Joy” below.

The quartet recently added a handful of new dates to their extensive 2025 tour, with additional shows in cities including Dublin, San Francisco, Toronto, and Boston. See the full itinerary below, and get tickets here.

“Metal,” the first single from Straight Line Is a Lie, was released in April. Pre-orders for the album are ongoing.
